results.title: Central Banks Accept Pain Now, Fearing Worse Later
results.abstract: Federal Reserve officials and their counterparts around the world are trying to defeat inflation by rapidly raising interest rates. They know it will come at a cost.

multimedia.caption: Volunteers at a food bank in London. The Bank of England on Thursday raised interest rates by half a point to 2.25 percent, even as it said that the United Kingdom might already be in a recession.
multimedia.copyright: Mary Turner for The New York Times
